orego.core

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • orego.core.Board

  • public class Board
extends Object
    Holds the current state of the board, allows moves to be played, etc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_MOVES_PER_GAME
      Maximum number of moves per game.
      static int PLAY_GAME_TOO_LONG
      The result returned by play() when the playout has run too long; only passes are legal near the end, to ensure that the playout ends by MAX_MOVES_PER_GAME.
      static int PLAY_KO_VIOLATION
      The result returned by play() when the move violates ko.
      static int PLAY_OCCUPIED
      The result returned by play() when the point is occupied.
      static int PLAY_OK
      The result returned by play() when the move is legal.
      static int PLAY_SUICIDE
      The result returned by play() when the move is suicide.
      static int[] UPDATE_NBR_MAP
      Maps to the bits which need updating in the ith neighbors' pattern.
      static long[][] ZOBRIST_HASHES
      Random numbers for Zobrist hashes, indexed by color and point.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_MOVES_PER_GAME

        public static final int MAX_MOVES_PER_GAME
        Maximum number of moves per game. It should be extremely rare to actually play this many moves, but a playout (which doesn't check superko) might run this long. It's faster to just cut off such unusual runs (by forcing passes) than to check for superko in playouts.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_GAME_TOO_LONG

        public static final int PLAY_GAME_TOO_LONG
        The result returned by play() when the playout has run too long; only passes are legal near the end, to ensure that the playout ends by MAX_MOVES_PER_GAME.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_KO_VIOLATION

        public static final int PLAY_KO_VIOLATION
        The result returned by play() when the move violates ko.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_OCCUPIED

        public static final int PLAY_OCCUPIED
        The result returned by play() when the point is occupied.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_OK

        public static final int PLAY_OK
        The result returned by play() when the move is legal.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLAY_SUICIDE

        public static final int PLAY_SUICIDE
        The result returned by play() when the move is suicide.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UPDATE_NBR_MAP

        public static final int[] UPDATE_NBR_MAP
        Maps to the bits which need updating in the ith neighbors' pattern. (If point n is my ith neighbor, I am the opposite neighbor, and each color takes up two bits.)

      • ZOBRIST_HASHES

        public static final long[][] ZOBRIST_HASHES
        Random numbers for Zobrist hashes, indexed by color and point. The last row is for the simple ko point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()

    • Method Detail

      • approximateScore

        public double approximateScore()
        Returns the score, including komi and counting only stones (not territory). Positive scores are good for black.

      • approximateWinner

        public int approximateWinner()
        Returns the winner, including komi and counting only stones (not territory).

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears this Board, initializing all data structures.

      • copyDataFrom

        public void copyDataFrom(Board that)
        Copies all data from that into this. Similar to cloning that, but without the overhead of creating a new object.

      • finalScore

        public double finalScore()
        Similar to playoutScore(), but can handle territories larger than one point. Assumes all stones on board are alive.

      • finalWinner

        public int finalWinner()
        Similar to winner(), but based on finalScore() instead of playoutScore().

      • getCapturePoint

        public int getCapturePoint(int p)
        Returns the move required to capture the stone at p, or NO_POINT if p is not in atari.

      • getChainId

        public int getChainId(int p)
        Returns the chain id of point p.

      • getChainNextPoint

        public int getChainNextPoint(int p)
        Returns the next point in p's chain. Only makes sense for occupied points.

      • getChainsInAtari

        public IntSet getChainsInAtari(int color)
        Returns the chains of color that are in atari.

      • getColor

        public int getColor(int p)
        Returns the color of point p.

      • getColorToPlay

        public int getColorToPlay()
        Returns the color (BLACK or WHITE) to play next.

      • getHandicap

        public int getHandicap()
        Returns the number of handicap stones used at the beginning of the game.

      • getHash

        public long getHash()
        Returns the zobrist hash of the current board position, including the simple ko point and color to play.

      • getKomi

        public double getKomi()
        Returns the komi.

      • getKoPoint

        public int getKoPoint()
        Returns the simple ko point, or NO_POINT if there is none.

      • getLiberties

        public IntSet getLiberties(int p)
        Returns the liberties of p.

      • getLibertyCount

        public int getLibertyCount(int p)
        Returns the number of liberties of the chain including point p.

      • getLibertyOfChainInAtari

        public int getLibertyOfChainInAtari(int chainId)
        Returns the liberty of the chain with the specified id, assuming it is in atari.

      • getMove

        public int getMove(int t)
        Returns the move played on turn t. If t is negative, returns NO_POINT.

      • getMoves

        public int[] getMoves()
        Returns the array of moves played on this board. Note that only elements in [0, t) are relevant.

      • getMoveSequence

        public String getMoveSequence()
        Returns a String containing a human-readable list of all moves made so far on this board.

      • getNeighborhood

        public final char getNeighborhood(int p)
        Gets the local 3x3 neighborhood around point p.
        See Also:
        orego.patterns

      • getNeighborhoodColorsReversed

        public final char getNeighborhoodColorsReversed(int p)
        Gets the local 3x3 neighborhood around point p with colors reversed.

      • getPasses

        public int getPasses()
        Returns the number of consecutive passes ending the move sequence so far.

      • getStoneCounts

        public int[] getStoneCounts()
        Returns the array stoneCounts, indicating the number of stones of each color on the board.

      • getTurn

        public int getTurn()
        Returns the current turn number (e.g., 0 at the beginning of the game).

      • getVacantNeighborCount

        public int getVacantNeighborCount(int p)
        Returns the number of vacant neighbors of point p.

      • getVacantPoints

        public IntSet getVacantPoints()
        Returns a list of vacant points.

      • hashAfterRemovingCapturedStones

        public long hashAfterRemovingCapturedStones(int p)
        Returns the hash value that would result if the captured stones were removed. Used by play() to detect superko.

      • isEyelike

        public boolean isEyelike(int p)
        Returns true if p is "like" an eye for colorToPlay, that is, is surrounded by friendly stones and having no more than one (zero at the board edge) diagonally adjacent enemy stones. It is almost always a bad idea to play in such a point.

      • isFeasible

        public boolean isFeasible(int p)
        Returns true if p is a feasible choice to play. The point must not be played on an eyelike point, and must either be on the 3rd or 4th row from the edge or be within a large knight's move of another stone.

      • isInAtari

        public boolean isInAtari(int chain)
        Returns true if chain is in atari.

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal(int p)
        Returns true if p is a legal move for color, without playing it.

      • isSelfAtari

        public boolean isSelfAtari(int p,
                  int color)
        Returns true if the play at move p would be a self-atari for color.

      • isWithinAKnightsMoveOfAnotherStone

        public boolean isWithinAKnightsMoveOfAnotherStone(int p)
        Returns whether a point is within a knight's move or less of another stone.

      • isWithinALargeKnightsMoveOfAnotherStone

        public boolean isWithinALargeKnightsMoveOfAnotherStone(int p)
        Returns whether a point is within a large knight's move or less of another stone.

      • pass

        public void pass()
        Plays a pass move.

      • play

        public int play(int p)
        Plays at p. If the move is illegal, there is no effect on Board data structures.
        Parameters:
        p - the location at which to play, or PASS.
        Returns:
        One of the PLAY_... constants defined in this class.
        See Also:
        playFast(int)

      • play

        public int play(String label)
        Convenience method for writing tests.
        See Also:
        play(int)

      • playFast

        public int playFast(int p)
        Plays at p. Similar to play(), but allows superko violations and does not check for passes or occupied points. In fact, once this has been used on a board, the superko table is no longer kept up-to-date. This method is used in the tails of playouts.
        Parameters:
        p - the location at which to play, or PASS.
        Returns:
        One of the PLAY_... constants defined in this class.

      • playoutScore

        public double playoutScore()
        Returns the score, including komi. Positive scores are good for black. Counts stones on board and one-point territories.

      • playoutWinner

        public int playoutWinner()
        Returns the winner, including komi.
        See Also:
        playoutScore()

      • removeStone

        public void removeStone(int s)
        Removes stones.

      • setColorToPlay

        public void setColorToPlay(int color)
        For testing only.

      • setUpHandicap

        public void setUpHandicap(int handicapSize)
        Sets up the starting handicap for a board. Must be between 2 and 9 stones.

      • setKomi

        public void setKomi(double komi)
        Sets the komi.

      • setPasses

        public void setPasses(int passes)
        Sets the number of consecutive passes just before now. For testing only.

      • setUpProblem

        public void setUpProblem(int colorToPlay,
                String... diagram)
        Plays all of the stones in diagram, row by row from top to bottom. See the code of BoardTest for example diagrams.

      • toProblemString

        public String[] toProblemString()
        Similar to toString(), but in a format that can be read in by setUpProblem().

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
